org.madeirahs.shared.database
Class Database

java.lang.Object
  org.madeirahs.shared.database.Database
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Database
extends Object
implements Serializable

Shared class representing the artifact database for the MHS-Collections project. Database provides all the means necessary for creating, editing and searching the database.

Author:
Brian Groenke
See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
private static class Database.ArtifactComparator
          Compares Artifact objects by accession number.
private static class Database.StringCrawler
          Provides a String evaluation and 2v1 comparison algorithm for finding relevant String based search results.
private  class Database.TimeValueCrawler
          Provides a simple method for comparing time related aspects of Artifacts and searching the Database for relevant results.

sync

public void sync(String loc,
                 String archiveDir,
                 DataProvider prov,
                 String usr,
                 ProgressMonitor prog)
          throws IOException
Synchronize the provider with this Database. The object is serialized and added both to the archives and currently active database object. The data is written to a temporary "partial" file which is then renamed to the actual file upon completion.

N.B: Forward slashes ('/') are automatically added between directories and output files. It is the responsibility of the caller to prevent occurrences of double or triple slashes ("//") if the provider won't tolerate this.

Parameters:
loc - the path of the archive directory relative to the DataProvider's working directory (or in whatever fashion it will recognize it).
archiveDir - the relative path of the archives directory from the given DataProvider.
prov - the DataProvider to which data will be written.
Throws:
IOException - if the DataProvider fails or returns null streams.

writeLocal

                throws IOException
Writes this Database to a store file at the given location.

getTimestamp

public long getTimestamp()
Returns the time in millis that the Database was uploaded to the server (last synced/updated).

Returns:
the last upload/sync time in System.currentTimeMillis() timebase or -1 if never uploaded.

getUser

public String getUser()
Returns the last recorded user who committed changes to the database.

Returns:
the username as a String or null if unknown

add

public void add(Artifact e)
         throws DuplicateArtifactException
Adds a new Artifact to the database. Note that the server database-store will not be updated until sync is called.

Parameters:
e - the Artifact to add
Throws:
DuplicateArtifactException - if the artifact already exists in the database. This exception should be caught and processed accordingly.
See Also:
addAndOverwrite}

addAndOverwrite

public void addAndOverwrite(Artifact e)
Adds a new Artifact to the database or overwrites an existing one. No exception will be thrown if an Artifact with the same accession number already exists, but the data position will be quietly reassigned.

Note: It is highly recommended that you call add before using this method. This verifies that you are aware the Artifact already exists and gives you a chance to notify the user, if applicable.

Parameters:
e - the Artifact to add or overwrite
See Also:
add}

_add

private void _add(Artifact e,
                  boolean forceOverwrite)
           throws DuplicateArtifactException
Actually performs action of synchronizing on the object lock and putting the Artifact into the Database.

Parameters:
e -
forceOverwrite -
Throws:
DuplicateArtifactException

remove

public boolean remove(Artifact e)
Removes the given Artifact (or any artifact with the same accession number) from the database.

Parameters:
e - the Artifact to remove.
Returns:
true if successfully removed, false otherwise.

contains

public int contains(Artifact e)
Uses a binary search algorithm to find the specified Artifact in the database. The value returned will be < 0 if nothing was found.

Parameters:
e -
Returns:
a value >= 0 that represents the Artifact's position in the database array or < 0 if no match was found.

getData

public Artifact[] getData()
Returns an array that is a direct copy of the Database's Artifact array.

Returns:

getSize

public int getSize()
Returns:
the size of the database's Artifact array (int value).

searchByField

public Artifact[] searchByField(Artifact.TimeField field,
                                Artifact query)
Search the database for the specified time attribute of the given Artifact.

Parameters:
field - denotes which time-related Artifact attribute to obtain.
query - the Artifact to be used as the query.
Returns:
an array of relevant search results.
